abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Vietnam National Health
            Support Project were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately unsatisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: project design benefit from
            ESW and analysis; consistency with government strategy is a
            key factor for successful programs; flexibility during
            implementation is important; procurement capacity and
            processes need to be carefully analyzed; results framework
            need to be carefully designed and can help operation; and
            reporting and documentation should embrace more candor in
            reflecting issues and constraints noted during supervision.
